subject: Real Estate
subcategory: Famous Properties That Changed the World
title: Rockefeller Center: A City Within a City
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Rockefeller Center: A City Within a City.

hook.text: In 1930, John D. Rockefeller Jr. began building 14 buildings on 22 acres in midtown Manhattan.

buildup.text: The project employed 40,000 workers during the Depression â€” the largest private construction job in history.

discovery.text: Rockefeller created a mixed-use concept: offices, retail, theaters, and public plazas in one campus.

twist.text: The famous ice rink was a temporary placeholder. It was supposed to be a garden, but nobody came.

climax.text: The complex pioneered the 'city within a city' model that every modern megaproject copies.

punchline.text: A temporary ice rink became a permanent icon.

quiz.question: What was the Rockefeller Center ice rink originally meant to be?
